summary:
**Meeting Overview**: The Community Development Commission (CDC) of Dallas, Texas, will hold its monthly meeting on February 6, 2025, at 6:00 PM, both in-person at City Hall and via videoconference. The meeting aims to discuss community development initiatives, budget updates, and other relevant matters impacting the community.

**Key Agenda Items**: The agenda includes a roll call, public speakers, and the approval of minutes from the previous meeting. Key discussions will focus on the FY 2023-24 CDC Annual Report, updates on the FY 2025-26 U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) budget, and the status of the Community Development Block Grant (CDBG) expenditures.

**Important Details**: Significant proposals include a briefing on the timely expenditure of CDBG funds and a preliminary update on upcoming neighborhood public meetings for FY 2025-26. The Chair's report will acknowledge staff and commission members, while the Vice Chair will also provide general acknowledgments.

**Action Items**: The main action item is the review and approval of the FY 2023-24 CDC Annual Report. Decisions regarding the report will be sought from the commission members during the meeting. Public participation is encouraged, with registration required for those wishing to speak. 

Overall, the meeting will address essential community development matters and seek approval for the annual report, ensuring transparency and engagement with the community.
